nodes.bodyText: why getDataSourceLinkId and not getDataSourceEntitiesId like the property name?
will change to getDataSourceEntityId.
You might want to raise the exception with the inner error here when the error is null.

documentCollection 's error is either the InnerError or TextAnalyticsError.
before calling .map(), the caller already take care of the scenario transform,  such that     `
Mono<Response<DocumentResultCollection<DetectLanguageResult>>> detectLanguageBatchWithResponse() 

called toDocumentResultCollection() which called Transforms.toTextAnalyticsError()
getDataSourceEntityId ?

We do this because there is another type with this name, right? is it the generated one?
what is the difference between both?
Yes. There is one generated one. Auto-generated one has setter methods.
and why we can't use that one?
You don't want to explore the setter to users and it is bad to change auto-generated code. It could be removed when doing code-gene with some settings. Created an issue to regenerate code base: #8344
Let's make sure that the docstring here specifies that these are confidence scores, not sentiment scores.
same here
Is this the autogenerated one? why we use one here and in other places the one from com.azure.ai.textanalytics.implementation.models.SentimentConfidenceScorePerLabel
It might be me and my limited knowledge of Java. It just seems strange how we are using for some things one and not other
This one is not autogenerated one and you don't want to explore an autogenerated class to user. Another place that using autogenerated one is for internal mapping to non-autogenerated class.
ugh so confusing. Thanks for clarifying it Shawn :)
Don't abbreviate, write out "Personally Identifiable Information" (PII)

nodes.bodyText: NIT: will never be empty

the confidence score....
Also, Add to docstrings that the score represents the Softmax score.

One sentiment label could have more than one score. So it should be plural?
e.g.,
DoucentSentimentLabel is negative with 0.1 positive, 0.1 neutral, 0.8 negative

One document (or sentence) has one sentiment label and has 3 confidence scores (positive, negative, neutral).
What I am pointing out here, same as Krista, is if you could modify the docstring.
You could use something like https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-net/blob/master/sdk/textanalytics/Azure.AI.TextAnalytics/src/DocumentSentiment.cs#L33
same here
is there a reason why there are so many format changes in the PR?
short line. Java use a tool to embeded code to readme, so maintaining a short line number is better for user experience.
Consider changing ID to Entity Id in Data Source
Same in other places like samples, code snippets, etc
Should we add something to the docstring about how when using this method, we are using the DefaultCountryHint value?

Python does similar
